header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: managing hostels, photo's, friends in hospital, cars, science, school, engineering, hardworking parents and their shops, abattoirs, food
header.activity: Chat over a cup of tea

was it good? was they said?
said the paperwork was excellent the the clcleanliness was excellent and the how we reacted with the people

kind of wonder if it's anything he worked with a long long time ago that's causing it

and we made that at school
so what did we do when we were kids? we went up the chemist and you could buy the stuff
you could buy the saltpetre you could buy the sulphur and you could buy the carbon or you could make the carbon but you could get it all from the chemist

and he looked and said that's a rotating centre on the tail stop

and then on the tail stop

I said it lines up either it lines up a lot easier than if you just try and put a cut across

lots of different things yeah there there's so many short shortcuts when when I was an apprentice they asked we used to have to make these er bearing housings for saw benches and they were turning them all out by hand and I thought there must be an easier way to this do this so I made up this you'd be fit it fit it in your tail stock and that was too sharp cos that that that was an aluminium that I was cutting and you I slid it in into the and you just pushed it in like that and that cut out lovely and all you had to do was finish it off and I was making no end of these things and getting bonus for er for them and had to hide them up because I mean you're allowed about five minutes each for them and I was doing them in a minute right?
because of my jig that I'd made up my my special tool that I'd made

which I had to hide up every night and I was getting no end of money bonus well I mean when you when you think I was getting six and six an hour which was what? thirty-three pence thirty-five pence something like that an hour but the bonus was a half a crown an hour so that made your money up no end you know and in the end I was getting ten bob an hour plus plus a half a crown an hour bonus and that years ago now ain't it?

but we we were making a lot of money it was good and me and we worked at engineering me and my cousin we used to do so much work we used to hide it up and go fishing and the foreman used to clock us in and clock us out
god you couldn't do anything like that now no no
no it's just totally different now

but I mean we used to have the time and motion study c people come along well that was it weren't it? they used to stand there funnily enough they knew nothing about lathe turning or anything like that they used to stand there in their white coats with their stopwatch right go and you'd find that gotta on you gotta do this that and the other and you'd get five minutes for it right? he'd go away you could do it in a minute
yeah but there you go I mean that was that was er what they charged they were making money we were making money

you've gotta look like you're doing you know what you're doing you have yeah

then your Vernier and getting that right that take a long while but when you've gotta tool that that does it one go and you've just gotta skim out a couple of thou
you always look for easy ways to do something

only take a bit of thinking wwhat used to annoy me though with these places that I worked in they used to have this box an ideas box which you put your idea in and if they took it on you used to get paid a couple of quid extra in your wage packet but they would be making hundreds of pounds out of your ideas

at where I used to work this bloke they had an ideas box of how to oxygenate the water w that was getting that they were passing through and this here bloke just put it in shingle he got twenty-six quid for it and they saved them thousands of pounds well hundreds of thousands of pounds
oxygenating oxygenating the water and then returning it back to where to be recycled you see
and they just used to pump it over over the shingle which bounced it about
oxygenated it and back in it went and and they made a lot of money out of that

there's always I mean there's there's always ways to do things I mean I remember b being a lab tech even when I was a lab technician if you knew what your syllabus was or the you could organise yourselves now if you we I had I had fifteen staff teaching staff and I had f at one point I had five technicians and a worksh and two workshop technicians and then they started cutting back and it went down to one workshop technician and three lab technicians
and it you know it was like what are you gonna do?

we'll get it sorted you know we'll get it sorted not a problem and I er I said but it's down to the staff you've gotta or you've gotta y stick to I want your equipment sheets in on a Friday so we know what lessons you want for the following week if you if you don't put it in on Friday and somebody else wants it
and I used to label it one two three when they came in so that the same piece of equipment
it was like you ca you ca you know you can't have it cos you were late getting it in type thing
and some staff d hated that
well I'm sorry but that's the way it is

and w it was er we got it we got it down to a T absolutely down to a T in the sense that you put your lessons out you put your lessons out and iif you could you would put your lessons out for the whole day
so by eleven o'clock by tea break at eleven o'clock you might be moving some stuff about but everything comes out for that day
and then you would be tidying up what you needed to do
and it would be like oh can we can we have this? and you'd s no not really well if you give me ten minutes I might be able to do it type of thing
you always found a way round
and then they brought this rule in that they were closed and that they were closing at Christmas so Christmas holidays closing
and you had to take your annual leave
and the argument was well I don't wanna take it at Christmas
I don't wanna take it at Christmas
you want it in the summer time
I want it in the summer
or I want it at Easter or you know
and when you've only got twenty days at that point in time
which you didn't have the same holidays as teachers you know erm well I would like a couple of days here and a couple of days there and and I why should I take it in the at Christmas?

I don't want to take it at Christmas I'll have my Christmas days off but I won't take it I said well what about if we worked overtime? don't get paid for it but we it allows us to have the Christmas period off
and it was like well will you be able to do it in that period of time? lilike heck you will
so we j we we just we kept a book
we f we were supposed to finish at half past four which is what we did but we worked till six o'clock

so you're looking at what? f that's four hours looking at five hours
you don't need to do many weeks
leading up to Christmas to get that time off
and sometimes it'd be a little bit later and you know everything everything was done wasn't wasn't a problem come Christmas period have all the time off

and still have your Christmas and still have your normal holiday time and it was like yeah and you know like you say like time and motion you can take a long time doing something if you're being watched because you need to but if you need to get it done you can
you can get it done in half the time
you can get it done in half the time
it's like it's like the summer holidays they used to say right you've got you know literally you have to do a spring clean on every classroom

okay? don't have a classroom each with your three t and er er in the summer time there was only two technicians cos one was only part time so there was two of us and we used to literally start in one lab and we had it straightforward we got we didn't I decided that I weren't gonna wash the test tubes
because I could buy test tubes that were quite cheap and all you did was replace them
so I used to buy really tea ches er test tubes for some experiments which w might get used three or four times
and then for the real w ones we had but a lot of it you used to buy the Pyrex test tubes so their cupboards would have large test tubes large and small test tubes and a rack of Pyrex test tubes
and you had a you kept a bucket with this stuff in erm and you used to leave them to soak and you'd lleave them to soak over the weekend didn't have a dishwasher or anything like that
which a lot of places have now but you just let them soak over the weekend in a sink of hot water come in on a Monday morning undo the sink swill them all out nice and
absolutely nice so the summer holidays they'd start okay and I would do this one lab all new beakers all the cupboards swept out and we it all the catch pots had to be done as well
so then you have to get rid of all the junk out of that so the flows would run and everything you couldn't do that y they wouldn't allow you to do that now but and we would g
things used to go down the sink in the in the science lab then
down the sink and into the
you can't do that any more
no so within a six-week holiday if we had a six-week holiday three weeks we would literally be getting everything done all the prep rooms tidy all the books remarked you know
